Text: Beautiful hotel but gaming is expensive.
Rooms are nicely decorated and decor in hotel is amazing.
Valet takes a long time so plan ahead.
Went to Tao ""beach"" pool.
Not a beach at all.
Super small pool and over priced drinks.
We just love staying at the Venetian.
The rooms have plenty of room and very comfortable.
Love having over 20 places to choose eating from plus the shopping for my wife was added bonus.
This place has it all.
If you have a bad review of this place then I don't think you can be pleased.
All their rooms are suites and it is just a beautiful place to walk around and enjoy.
This is the best hotel the room was perfect.
The service was over the top.
Splurged for one night at the Venetian...
Stayed in a Bella suite that was awesome.
Front desk, valet, bellhop all attentive and friendly.
Would stay here again but next time for longer than one night!
Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and thought it was amazing,the standard is top quality only rivalled by the Bellagio & Wynn.
We stayed in the piazzo suites which where new and very nice.
Ate at the hotel for every meal as the Resturants were very good.
we came with three kids after a few days of travelling in Utah's desert and big parks...
it was fun to be in this elegant and indulging hotel.
we were offered to upgrade our room and we did.
it was a reasonable price.
the hotel is huge.
Really nice always clean  and lot of security for guests.

the only thing that we didnt like is that we got offered an upgrade with ""excellent view of the city"" so we paid the extra ammount but the suite didnt had a view of the city but instead of the building infront...
that was a little dissapointing.
Besides that the suite was really nice.
I like the Venetian - i have stayed there twice.
This particular room for this stay needed some upkeep.
There was a very loud ""glug"" sound in the sink that would occur way after you turned off the water.
I like the restaurants in the venetian but several of the restaurants that appeared to be operating and open on their website were closed.
Two of them in particular had all the lights on and looked set up but no one was ever in them, even at different times of the day.
There were two other conferences going on and it never seemed too out of control crowded.
I think what I miss (from being in Texas) is the availability of fruit.
It is always the hardest thing to find - but maybe I am missing something.
Overall, it was fine.
Very happy with all services.
Hotel stuff very good, check in very short waiting time, quality of restaurants was excellent, rooms clean and comfortably
unbelievable, fine architecture, shopping,  gondolas, staffFirst class , must book it !
Hotel was exceedingly well maintained.
All employees were very helpful .
Room was very comfortable and always clean.
Would definitely stay again on our next visit to Las Vegas.
Everything was fantastic, only down side was parking was too far from check in
Went for mothers day weekend.
Hotel had the posh I expected plus the party my boyfriend wanted.
We had a great time.
Lots of fantastic food and experiences.
Great placeOnly suggestion is recommending when knocking on the door refraining from using a key card ring or key chain to knock with.
But using your hand index finger making a natural knocking sound , Instead of a mechanical one.
Its much more pleasaant and especially at 8 in the morning.
Besides that it was a very beautifull location and had a great time.
but the bathroom was dirty with hair in tub and sinks, plumbing was gurgling for 5 straight days, and sheets were soiled and had little balls.
we changed rooms and had the same thing!
finally after waiting 3 hours, housekeeper came and we had to point out everywhere to clean.
I have never had this experience before even in a modest hotel.
we were not offered any sort of compensation and nor did I ask for it.
Great bang for your buck, don't stay anywhere else!
Venetian is a great 5 star hotel!
Staff was friendly and pleasant.
Rooms very comfortable and clean.
Can't wait to go back again
our stay at the Venetian was terrific.
I Called ahead to tell them it was my wife's 40th and they upgraded our room with no charge.
The concierge was very helpful obtaining dinner reservations and also giving recommendations for things to do during our stay.
Tao beach was Awesome Thursday!
The hotel is beautiful and well kept.
The only issue we had was finding our way around.
The hotel is now connected to the resort next door and it is VERY easy to get lost.
You take one elevator after check-in to another floor where you walk quite a bit to take another elevator to your room.
After making it to your room floor, you could walk another 2 or 3 minutes to get to your room, depending on where it is.
But even with the confusion which dissipates after about 3 days, it is an ideal place to stay.
Conviently Located to shops, restaurants & entertainment!
It's a beautiful place, good, not great service, centrally located, a little difficult to navigate, but they all are in Vegas.
Check in was a little abrupt and robotic.
Concierge nice but lacked attention to detail.
Stayed here with my man and the rooms were amazing very spacious and decor was up to date.
Everyone I know who goes to Vegas highly recommends to stay here and I agree.
Great location, lots to do, rooms are spacious and upscale.
Staff was great-had a minor problem with the sink drain and the maintenance guy arrived in 5 minutes and gone in 2 minutes.
The suite was huge, and very nicely put together.
The beds were comfy, and the staff was extremely helpful with regards to check-out time.
Loved the ambience and the hotel itself.
Venetian is a great place to stay, fantastic hotel, great rooms, and close to the things that we wanted to do.
Food in all the restaurants was excellent.
Had a fabulous time at the Venetian!
It is a beautiful hotel with all the amenities.
Would absolutely stay here again.
We will go back to the Venetian at the very first opportunity.
My family and I were celebrating a Surprise 60th Birthday for my father & I shared that with the front desk.
It was a very exciting trip for my family as my father has not been to Vegas in years!
I wish the Hotel would have offered some suggestions for the dining or done something small or sweet to make the experience more memorable.

I live in New York and travel a lot for work and have had various other Hotels that don't charge nearly as much for our stay and treat their guest with a lot more enthusiasm, more personable, and accommodating.
When there is so much competition in Vegas with Hotels I would expect an Outstanding experience that would make me want to come back to only your Hotel.
The location of the hotel is good, food at TAO is perfect .
The shops at the Venetian is really Good one side that i didnt not expect is the room and bed not so comfortable .
Overall it is a great Hotel though .
very pleasant very close to all shops convinient excellent
Great hotel, great location and staff.
We left behind a one of our shopping bags at the room, we immediately called lost and found from the airport but they still have not been able to locate our missing bag with our shopping.
Lovely suite and hotel facilities at the Venetian.
Enjoyed the Rock of Ages show, the many wonderful restaurants, bars and shopping.
Near the Mob museum and Stratesphere - both must do's.
Would love to attend a conference at the Venetian.
Very pleasant to eyes and beautiful decor.
I would say the best hotel in Vegas
The Venetian is a beautiful luxury hotel/casino right in the middle of the strip with easy access to all the high-end shopping you would want.
We checked in and at 11:00 AM, were helped immediately, and did not have to wait for a room.
We requested a non-smoking room, but our suite had clearly been smoked in.
We were assisted by a housekeeping manager and the hotel gave us a new suite on a higher floor with a better view of the strip.
Every staff member, from the ladies and gentlemen who open your car door upon arrival, the front desk people, the bell hops, to the housekeeping staff are friendly, welcoming and helpful.
There is a nice level of security, and each entrance to the guest suite elevators is manned by a guard who checks room keys.
Also, the security people at the main entrances do not allow people in who are shirtless or shoeless, etc. Prevents that ""Jersey Shore"" atmosphere.
The suite was one of the best we have ever stayed in, and we have stayed in a lot of high-end hotels.
Every convenience was provided.

The bed was fantastic, there was a large closet, the living room had a comfortable sectional sofa and automatic opener on the shades and draperies, the bathroom was all marble with double sinks, a separate tub and shower, and an enclosed toilet room.
TV in every room (3).
Could not hear guests in other rooms or hallways.
Huge hotel, but plenty of elevators, never waited more than 30 seconds for up or down.
All of the staff was very friendly.
Room service was quick and enjoyable.
The food was great.
Strengths: large, quiet, comfortable, beautiful designWeakness: need to pay extra for a better view and hot water kettle; the  lights in the room are quite dark; there is no fan in the washroom
I will highly recommend this hotel any time - we had an amazing stay and will come back to the Venetian on our next visit.
We arrived at noon, 3 hours prior to check in.
They had a room ready, and didn't even question it, checked us right in.
They also waived the $20 a day fee for us (not sure why, but ok!
# which saved us $80!
We were advised that anything we touched in the mini fridge would be charged immidiately.
One evening my boyfriend was putting some extra beers we had IN to the fridge and knocked over quite a few items.
On check out we explained this, and they didn't even question it, took it right off the bill.
We're pretty casual people, and they had an amazing pub with a patio right on the strip, the Rattlecan, and we LOVED it there.
Amazing service, great food, and WHAT a location to sit down after a long day out and about exploring the strip.
The hotel was immaculate, the staff went over and above, the hotel itself is beyond anything I could describe, you have to see it to believe it kinda thing, and it just MADE our trip.
If there is one thing I could say, is this would not be a hotel for someone that isn't able to walk around with ease...
we were in the Venezia tower #OH, and AMAZING view of the strip too!
) and it was quite a hike, a little confusing to get to as well, as you have to take two elevators.
But compared to the rest of our experience, that was nothing for us!
I can't wait to go back!
And next time we're bringing our friends!
The hotel was absolutely amazing!
Our hotel room was just the basic room, and it was so spacious and beautiful.
The staff were very friendly and there was lots of food options.
The pool area was so beautiful and clean.
We did not have even 1 complaint about our whole trip
the hotel is well placed on the strip with great facilities
This was my first visit to Vegas, so I tried to pack in as many sights and activities as possible.
After extensive exploration I was really happy that we stayed at the Venetian.
It's definitely one of the top two or three nicest hotels on the Strip.
The room felt luxurious and the shops and restaurants along the canals are really pretty.
I thought it was more charming than the similar village setup in Paris, Las Vegas.
Less smokey, too.
Free wifi in the room was a nice touch, but I wish there had been a coffee maker, too.
We found the BEST breakfast buffet at Cafe Lux inside the Venetian - only $18 and everything was done to perfection.
Staff were very helpful and the attention to detail is top notch.
Excellent place to go.
It is one of the prettiest hotels in Las Vegas.
The Venetian is a wonderfully appointed resort with great attention to detail.
The hotel is essentially a destination unto itself.
Rooms are spacious and elegant.
I have been to the resort 8 times now and always enjoy my stay.
The pool areas are outstanding with attention to cleanliness and well designed.
The pool is one of the few open all year round in Vegas.
The shopping is plentiful and the casino is better ventilated than most (less smoke, lots of air freshener).
The hotel is attached to the Palazzo (same company) which has a convenient Avis rent a car desk, if you choose to leave the strip for the day.
The staff are always friendly and professional.
Room was far from ice machines nut that's it!
Staff polite and helpful!
Perfect location, amazing suite, totally romantic!
It was a blast, and I can't wait to do it again.
The Venetian offered all the draws of Vegas-- casinos, shopping, food, parties-- without being overwhelming or tacky.
A good choice for a romantic stay or if you need a bit of serenity on the strip.
Second time staying at the Venetian.
Husband and I came for a long weekend a couple months ago.
Decided to come again (during Thanksgiving week), this time with in-laws accompanying.
We all had a relaxing and enjoyable vacation.
Great hotel for a holidayVery hard working staff, constantly keeping all public areas very clean
Very good service,make me feel at home.
First time in vegas and we were blown away by the service and room at the Venetian.
The best shower ever!
The in-suite dining is expensive but well worth it.
We ordered before we knew there was a food court downstairs, but still got plenty for the money.
Beautiful Hotel, big nice comfortable rooms.
Many restaurants to choose from,also got several fast food places as well.
Food prices from $ to $$$$.
They have four pools.
They only had 3 open while we where there,one was close for cleaning.
This Hotel right in the heart of the Strip.
The suite was very comfortable and the staff was great.
Restaurant choices were excellent.
This may be my official hotel for all future trips to Vegas.
Loved the fact that there are lots of shops and restaurants below the hotel so if it is wet outside, or too warm,one doesn't even need to leave the hotel.
Beautiful, spacious suites.
Pool can get a little crowded, but what else can you expect in such a busy place as LV.
The hotelis a little oasis in the midst of the hubbub.
Room was not nonsmoking, but was otherwise nice.
And was a fair value.
Rooms were clean and spacious.
Very classy and elegant hotel but usually exorbitantly priced.
We were pleased with the quality of the service and the room.
The pool was exceptionally crowded on a June saturday.
I had a wonderful experience at the Venetian.
Great room and a overall beautiful hotel.
The Pastrami sandwich from room service and the French Onion soup were awesome!
I was very pleased with the service.
From check in to check out everything went smoothly.
We had arrived a few hours before normal check in time but our room was ready and there was no extra fee as some places charge.

Hotel was easy to get around and yes it is big but if you follow the signs you will not have any problems also sometimes fun to just roam as it reminded us so much of Venice, Italy and relaxing to just stop and take it in.
The bed was the most comfortable we have had at any hotel anywhere and the suite size was terrifc, will be tough to book smaller rooms on our next trip, lol.
Huge variety of food and refreshments.
Highly recommend the Grand Lux cafe and Valentino.
Not so much First Food as we felt snubbed a bit.
Did not get to Grimaldi's but heard the pizza was fantastic.
Well worth the extra cost and nice to splurge sometimes as it was my wife's 50th and she really enjoyed.
Booked a luxury suite with a view and was on 22nd floor with view of mountains and other resorts on the strip.
The Venetian is beautiful.
We reserved the Luxury View Suite and it was very nice.
Best hotel stay in a long time.
Wonderful room enjoyed canal shoppes and the concert
Loved the spacious suite, but we were very disappointed by the service on many occasions during our three-night stay.
- We were given a suite with a faulty lock -- it took 45 minutes before a hotel staff came up to help us get into the suite.
The front desk sent someone to fix the lock and we were assured that all was fine, but the problem reoccurred the next day.
- My family needed hot drinking water but there was no kettle in the room.
Hotel staff confirmed that kettles are not provided in the suites, but they can send one to us -- for a fee.
This is in addition to the resort fee.
- Room was not made up on day 2. Hardly the type of service we expected at the Venetian.
Hotel staff was friendly and accommodating.
Enjoyed my stay at the Venetian, however, it seemed to have had a moth problem that the staff wasn't able to Contain.
Also, poor internet reception in my room!
The rooms are huge!
Hands down a great place to stay!
Clean and comfortable, friendly staff.
Made our holiday special, thank you Venetion.
would stay there again!
You have to try prime burger restaurant.
We had great service and it was the best burger I have ever had!
The Venetian was amazing!
I booked at the last possible minute so I ended paying a little bit more for a room.
The room turned out to be a junior suite and when I saw what I payed for I wasn't upset at all.
I will definitely put this at the top of my list for future Vegas visits.
We enjoyed our stay at The Venetian.
My only complaint is the horrible WiFi connection.
It was extremely slow and often lost connection.
I'm glad I was on vacation on no there for business and it would have been unusable for business.
Beautiful hotel with lots to see and do.
Gondola ride was amazing.
We upgraded to a ""strip view"" room for $45 extra a night.
We were actually charged an extra $50/night.
The $25/night hotel fee was actually $28/night.
Strip view room was very noisy.
Even on the 27th floor music from Tao Beach could be heard early in the morning.
After a late night who wants to wake up before noon with music from the pool.
Next time will be staying at the Cosmopolitan.
Everyone was extremely nice!
More amenities than I could ever imagined!
I love the Venetian, I have stayed there many times.
There is plenty to do within the hotel (visit the canals, shopping, pools, food, gambling, etc).
The only downside is that the bed wasn't too comfortable, but the room was amazing.
I took my mom for Christmas and couldn't say enough positive things.
It was my second stay and it was just as lovely as the first time.
We stayed in the cheapest priced room...
and it was amazing.
We stayed on the 31st floor and elevator service was fast and easy.
Our daughter was married there via the hotel marriage service.
They did a great job with the ceremony...
We stayed two nights.
The grounds and the whole experience and location of hotel made for a fabulous experience.
Great hotel, will always stay there.
I love everything about the hotel.
The scenery, the clubs, the casino, the food.
If I was a negative person I could say lots of negatives about the Venetian and Vegas but I'm not.
Our stay went off without a glitch.
What more could we ask for?
Very large bathroom with soaker tub, seperate water closet, double sink and vanity/powder area.
Very large king sized bed and sleeping area with big screen TV.
Very large sunken living room with another big screen, desk, table, couch and chairs.
All with a large window and view overlooking the beautiful treed garden pool and hot tub gardens/courtyard below.
Casino and gambling in an area by its own and not in your face like most other resorts.
The Grand Canal area with it shops and restaurants and singing gondoliers was a very relaxing, calming and tranquil place even when it was busy.
If you just visit Vegas to gamble and walk the strip when you aren't sleeping then it may not be worth the extra expence.
If you want to kick back and relax in a ""just like home"" comfy room after a long day then do yourself a favour and spend the extra money for it at The Venetian.
The only negative was not being a pot smoker because it was kinda thick on our floor some nights and I could have gotten a free buzz.
I mentioned this to the concierge and I am confidant they won't tolerate it in the future.
You won't be disappointed with the Venetian unless your glass is always half empty.
I left there and returned home with a full glass of 5 star satisfaction and rejuvenation.
Where we stay next time in Vegas will be a NO BRAINER
I had never stayed at the Venetian...
The room was great, and the hallways are very nicely decorated in royal blue and gold.
There was ice just down the hall.
The pool was nice, but they ran out of chairs on Sat...
but it's summer, so go early if you want a lounge chair.
There's a large convenient/shaded bar at the pool.
We stayed in room 5-418.
Our view was fantastic!
The bed was great and a very clean room.
I would stay here again and again.
Very good pool area.
Hotel staff are fantastic.
Check in and out was super easy.
Many front desk staff.
Comps from casino were non existant.
I put a lot of money on the tables.
Still a good hotel to stay at.
The Venetian was the perfect hotel for a trip to Vegas.
Loved having so many restaurant and shopping choices right in the hotel, and being close enough to the strip without having to deal with some of the riff raff that comes from it.
The hotel conceirge and staff was great, except for the luggage desk outside the hotel.
We waited over 20 mins for 2 suitcases that we had checked at the luggage desk, and the luggage attendant was extremely rude and acted as thought we were inconveniencing him.
My advice, if you do check your luggage, make sure to leave at least a 30 minute window for pick up.
We celebrated 25 yrs of marriage in The Ventian and was not disappointed at all.
We highly recommend choosing this hotel, it is absolutely wonderful.
We stayed five days and the rooms are a great value for Vegas.
The suites are spacious, well maintained and clean.
I would stay again.
Take plenty of money with youIt's really expensive
This hotel always fits our needs and is so amazing for the price.
Staff is courteous, honorable mention to check out clerk.
Brilliant experience excellent hotel...
There are so most wonderful hotels in Las Vegas I am not recommended this.
There was an additional charge of $25 daily for a Resort Fee.
This allowed use of the fitness facility and daily free coffee and newspaper.
The refrigerater in the room was small and there was no space for leftover food from the restaurants.
There was no coffee maker in the room.
The hotel is beautiful and the Grand Canal shops and restaurants were outstanding.
No charge for Valet parking.
The hotel was beautiful, but it was frustrating to have to pay an extra $75 per night because they had overbooked their rooms with a king bed.
To be able to have a room with a king bed in it, we had to upgrade to a ""room with a view"" and PAY to ""upgrade"".
If we did not pay the extra, we would have a room with two queens which was NOT what we paid for on Expedia.
We felt like it was a scam!
It was an awesome experience to stay in this hotel.
Everything you want and need in one huge, monumental place.
Huge shopping mall, great gondola canals, robust casino and everiyhing colored by the funny italian/venezia style.
I had a wonderfull experience with my wife, but I would reccommend this hotel/resort/center to anyone who wants to taste the glamour and excitement from Las Vegas, even ok with children.
The service was amazing, increasing the experience far above the expectations, which were already high.
Considering the amount of people staying there and the huge inflow and outflow of guests, the feeling of customer focus is surprising.
And last but not least, the value for moneay is simply amazing.
I found that one of electronic key was not working and the water flush was not functioning properly...
minor issues but the key issue kept us standing outside the room for few minutes until someone helped us with it.
The suites are beautiful and the hotel has so many things to do.
My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed an anniversary long weekend.
Good rooms, clean and neat.
great service and comfortable stay.
#1-It's Vegas!
#2 anything you needed was available at all times #3 the staff was extra friendly and the suites are amazing.
Wish we could have rode in the gandalas!
Staff all friendly and efficient without exception.
The hotel lacks some personal touches.
Some hotel employees seem very new to their roles.
We were asked to move from a section of the garden pool at approximately 3pm so they could set up for an ""event"" without initiall finding chairs for us to sit in the non event section.

This was all done without prior warnings or postings and the way it was handled was affecting several guest including another couple and myself calling the way they handled this ""outrageous""Bouchon on the 10th floor was outstanding.
The Venetian was more than I expected and then some!
The room was nice and actually depicted the pictures online.
Hotel staff (all of them) was very friendly, knowledgeable, and professional.
The architectural design in hotel, restaurant row, and shops were absolutely amazing!
This was my and my wife's visit to The Venitian and were not disappointed.
A little too expensive for us but for those who can afford it,I recommend it.
I have Never stayed at a nicer hotel .
From check in to check out was an unbelievable experience for myself and my husband.
We where there for our 25th wedding anniversary.
Will will definitely stay there again while in Vegas.
Our suite was amazing.
The rooms were spacious and the decor was beautiful.
It was as we expected.
Pool was great, room was great, well located on the strip.
Right in the middle of the strip it was perfect to walk anywhere
My husband rented a suite for my 60th birthday weekend.
Beautiful hotel, and a great location on the Strip.
Our stay at the Venetian could not have been more pleasant.
we stayed there for 5 days.
Check in and getting to room was a breeze.
Had a problem with the WIFI in the room and it was solved within half an hour, most friendly and accommodating staff.
The room was spotless as well as the pools and spas.
You can get lost and dazzled by what they have to offer.
Italian music all over, gives you the impression of almost being in Venice.
well what can I say, vast, glamorous as for wining the jack pot...
Instead of standing in a long line for check out, I opted for the card passed out by the hotel employee.
This promised that my receipt would be emailed to me.
I have not received it.
had a very pleasant stay room was clean and very comfy had everything i needed.
Would have liked to have had coffee near by without having to go all the way down to the cafe area.
The hotel is superb.
Couldn't ask for better.
It's let down by its restaurant service though.
Most of them don't seem to care about their customers.
My advice is stay there but eat elsewhere.
It was awesome, and was able to get a good price.
But the view of our hotel was blocked by a building so we didn't appreciate the night view.
All of the staff I came across were friendly and helpful.
The room service food at 4 am was also delicious.
My husband and I went to the Venetian for our Anniversary, we had a graet time.
I would recommend this hotel and plan on going back.

My friend booked two suites using his credit card and called Venetian to confirm that if I would be able to check out using different debit card or cash at front desk but at the time of checkout they flatly refused and charged the credit card of my friend.
So be careful while making your bookings, Overall Hotel is nice to stay but they must train their customer service reps well to answer the questions.
Enjoyed a 7 night stay in the best hotel on the strip.
Extremely large rooms with a sunken livingroom and a huge tiled bathroom with seperate tub & shower, double sinks, enclosed toilet area, and makeup vanity.
3 televisions and a stocked beverage fridge were a plus!
Hotel also has amazing shopping and excellent restaurants with nightclubs.
Very pleased with our choice.
Despite the Venetian having a great casino, we spent the majority of our time on the strip and taking in as much as we could.
The hotel is first class; as are the staff.
We would recommend the limousine transfer to and from the airport as it removes you from the stresses at the front entrance.
Shopping was great (go the the fashion show shopping centre).
Our sixth visit to the Venetian and, as expected, every aspect of the facility is first class, from the room/suites to the restaurants and top notch entertainment (Human Nature is a must see).
The service provided is most curtious and always done ith a smile whether it be a request for additional pillows or early maid service.
We will be back
The Venetian is just the best.
I would highly recommend it.
The reservation staff was awesome.
If I was say anything negative it would be the  concierge staff.
They weren't that friendly.
But I only went to the desk once, maybe all of them were having a bad day.
Attended a firm conference at the Venetian.
Conference facilities were excellent, rooms beautiful but hotel staff lacked personality or the desire to go above the minimum energy requirement for their jobs.
(With the exception of the housekeeping staff...
There were a lots of ""Firsts"" for us this trip.

We had a great suite, wonderful meal at the Aqua Knox, which I highly recommend, and New Years eve fireworks from our window which was a spectacular show from MIrage and Treasure Island, one of the best shows I've seen too was Rock of Ages all right here at the Venetian.
We hardly left, as it's so massive and so much to see and do.
The shopping, dining, something for all to do.
We will be back!
This hotel was amazing!
The room and service were great!
Also the casino and restaraunts were amazing and well priced as well.
I would recommend it.

Me and my Fianc stayed here for 2 nights on our honeymoon,we decided to go for a suit on the top floor and it was worth every penny, the room was huge, staff great, very clean and we loved the experience.
If you're going to stay in Vegas do it in style and pay the extra for something like this.
We've stayed at the Venetian many times.
It is always a pleasure to stay there.
The hotel is nice and all.
but Nobody ever explained to me that after I paid thru expedia over 750.00 dlls per 4 night trip.
the hotel was going to charge 230 dlls more per fee.
that includes having a refrigerator in the roon a thing i did not ask for and never used .
i do not think is fair so i will not stay again or even by here again.
I stay at the Venetian twice a year.
Always book through expedia.
On this trip the check in staff treated me like a dog because I booked through Expedia.
There was a problem with my room and a young man named Vu told me it was not his problem and to ,""...
take it up with Expedia...
The problem was eventually resolved because I made such a ruckus that it was easier to placate me than have me arrested in front of other guests.
Don't think they'll ever get any more of my money.
If everything goes fine then you'll never know it but if there is an issue Expedia customers get pretty shabby treatment.
They were busy and tried to stick me in an out of the way room that was not what booked.
I'll spend my money at the Wynn next time.
Very nice facility, wonderful rooms, excellent service.
Only negative-this place is huge.
Had to take two sets of elevators to get to rooms.
Long walks to get to everything.
We prefer a casino/resort that is a little more manageable.
Expierence above expectationsAmazing viewGreat location
This is a fabulous hotel.
The whole experience of staying here is akin to being Royalty.
I loved every minute of it and can't wait to return.
The hotel, staff and experience was superb.
The only flaw was a sewer smell from the washrooms, pool area and sinks.
Definitely don't drink the tap water.
The awful part of this hotel and everything in Vegas for that matter is the price gauging.
A bottle of water for $9.00?
$22.00 for a drink?
They say free drinks in the casino...
I never managed to get a waitress or a single free drink.
I guess its only for people who are in there all day.
When you were paying for service, it was exceptional...
don't forget extra for tips which are on everythinnnnng.
